bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Underwood and Underwood, April 18, 1951

div1.p: Hench requests photographs of Walter Reed and the people and places associated with the yellow fever experiments. He also seeks photographs of the Nobel Prize ceremonies.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Underwood and Underwood, April 18, 1951
div1.opener:
MAYO CLINIC
ROCHESTER, MINNESOTA
April 18, 1951
PHILIP S. HENCH, M. D.
CHARLES H. SLOCUMB, M. D.
HOWARD F. POLLEY, M. D.
Underwood and Underwood
News and Stock Photos
3 West 46th Street
New York, New York
Gentlemen:
div1.p:
I am writing a book on the conquest of yellow fever. This con-
cerns chiefly the human interest story of Walter Reed and his associates
which was dramatized some years ago in the play “Yellow Jack.” I am
anxious to obtain photographs connected with this enterprise. I know that
some were taken and they would involve photographs of Walter Reed in
Washington between 1890 and 1902; Walter Reed and his associates in Havana,
Cuba in the summer of 1900; also photographs of Camp Columbia, the American
Army camp just outside of Havana; photographs of “Camp Lazear”, Walter
Reed's experimental camp in Quemados de Marianao, a suburb of Havana and
photographs of General Wood's headquarters in Havana and also old photographs
of Havana around 1900 - such as Military Hospital No. 1, Los Animas Hospital,
etc. Perhaps some photographs might be listed under the names of Dr. Jesse
W. Lazear; Dr. Aristides Agramonte and Dr. James Carroll. all this happened
during & just after the Spanish - American war.

A more recent interest of mine is the Nobel Festival in Stockholm,
December 10, 1950. I had the good fortune of participating in that event
and am trying to make a fairly complete collection of photographs of the
event. I received quite a few in Stockholm but wondered whether your
photographic agency had received any.

I should appreciate an early reply to this letter. I expect to
be in New York the weekend of April 27 and 28. If you think you might
have something for me to look over at that time, I should be glad to stop
at your office.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, P. S. Hench, M. D. PSH:alc
